title.narrative: SOCIAL MOBILIZATION/COMMUNITY ENGAG. Communication for Development (C4D)

description.narrative: Communication for development, through effective and innovative strategic partnerships with communities, fosters social mobilization and community engagement in order to improve supply of and demand for services., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communication for development, through effective and innovative strategic partnerships with communities, fosters socialmobilization and community engagement in order to improve supply of and demand for services.

description.narrative: A la suite d’actions de plaidoyer et de renforcement de capacités des acteurs de mise en œuvre en Communication de Risque et Engagement Communautaire, les acteurs, y compris au niveau communautaire, se sont engagées et ont contribué à instaurer un environnement favorable pour l’adoption de bonnes pratiques. Au total 8 083 482 et 4 564 371 personnes ont amélioré leurs connaissances et compétences respectivement sur les bonnes pratiques de la riposte contre les épidémies et sur les pratiques familiales essentielles. Les résultats de trois études socio anthropologiques ont contribué à améliorer les stratégies de riposte contre les épidémies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:02/02/2022
